thread.title: Denny Hamlin signs contract extension to remain at Joe Gibbs Racing
thread.title_full: Denny Hamlin signs contract extension to remain at Joe Gibbs Racing

title: Denny Hamlin signs contract extension to remain at Joe Gibbs Racing
text:
Let friends in your social network know what you are reading about Facebook Email Denny Hamlin signs contract extension to remain at Joe Gibbs Racing Hamlin was entering 2017 on the final season of a four-year contract signed in 2012. Post to Facebook Denny Hamlin signs contract extension to remain at Joe Gibbs Racing Hamlin was entering 2017 on the final season of a four-year contract signed in 2012. Check out this story on USATODAY.com: http://usat.ly/2mcuWjY Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Nation's Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Denny Hamlin signs contract extension to remain at Joe Gibbs Racing Brant James, USA TODAY Sports Published 3:11 p.m. ET Feb. 23, 2017 | Updated 30 minutes ago NASCAR driver Denny Hamlin. (Photo: Mark J. Rebilas, USA TODAY Sports) 83 CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
DAYTONA BEACH, Fla. – Denny Hamlin’s long-anticipated contract extension to remain at Joe Gibbs Racing is official, the team announced on Thursday, with sponsor FedEx also to remain in the fold as the primary sponsor of the No. 11 Toyota. 
Hamlin, 36, has 29 career wins in 398 starts at NASCAR’s top level over 14 seasons, finishing third in twice and runner-up in points in 2010. He enters Speed Weeks as the defending Daytona 500 winner. 
Hamlin was entering the season on the final season of a four-year contract extension signed in 2012. He would not characterize the length of the deal but said ““I’ll be much grayer” at its conclusion. Facebook Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. The drivers stand on stage as fireworks erupt during introductions for the Advance Auto Parts Clash at Daytona International Speedway. The race originally was scheduled for Feb. 18 but was moved to Feb. 19 because of rain. John David Mercer, USA TODAY Sports Joey Logano celebrates with his crew in victory lane after winning the Advance Auto Parts Clash at Daytona International Speedway. John David Mercer, USA TODAY Sports Joey Logano performs a burnout after winning the season-opening Clash on Feb. 19. John David Mercer, USA TODAY Sports Joey Logano takes the checkered flag after completing a last-lap pass to win The Clash. Jared C. Tilton, Getty Images Brad Keselowski (2) and Denny Hamlin (11) make contact allowing Joey Logano (22) to surge to the lead on the last lap. Kyle Busch (18) finished second. John David Mercer, USA TODAY Sports Martin Truex Jr. (78) and Chris Buescher (not pictured), each spun out and were knocked out of the race on lap 61. Chase Elliott (24) drove by unscathed. Jerry Markland, Getty Images Jimmie Johnson hits the inside wall after losing control of his car coming out of Turn 4 on lap 49. Johnson's car was towed to the garage. Phelan M. Ebenhack, AP Kurt Busch careens onto the infield grass after contact with Jimmie Johnson (not pictured) sent him crashing and spinning during the first stage of The Clash. Chris Graythen, Getty Images Brad Keselowski, bottom front, and Denny Hamlin, top front, lead the field as the green flag flies at the Advance Auto Parts Clash. Terry Renna, AP Air Titans work to dry the track as rain fell before the start of The Clash. NASCAR officials decided to reschedule the race for Sunday morning, Feb. 19. John David Mercer, USA TODAY Sports Drivers are introduced prior to The Clash. The race was originally scheduled for Saturday night but the green flag did not drop until Sunday morning. Terry Renna, AP Like this topic? You may also like these photo galleries: Replay
